abstract.para: This document is intended for software developers who are interested in developing applications using the Rackspace CDN Application Programming Interface (API).

revdescription.para: Rackspace CDN has been updated to include the following items:

listitem.para: Added the geography parameter to restrictions for the Create a service operation to enable the specification of a country that you want to restrict requests from.
Added project_id to the response for the Retrieve a service and Retrieve all services operations.
Added SLA information to the Purge a cached asset operation.

revdescription.para: Rackspace CDN has been updated to include the following items:

listitem.para: Added cache invalidation to the Purge a cached asset operation by adding the hard query parameter. The default value for hard is set to false, which does cache invalidation, while setting hard to true does an actual purge.
Added access with valid values of whitelist and blacklist to restrictions for the Create a service operation to allow or block access.
Added request_url and client_ip to rules for the Create a service operation to enable restriction rules for URLs and IP addresses.
Fixed an issue to now disallow entering a root domain for the domain field in a service.
Fixed an issue where now a TTL of 0 seconds is treated as “no-cache” with Akamai.
Rackspace CDN has been updated to include host header information by adding the hostheadertype and hostheadervalue parameters to the Create a service request.

Rackspace CDN has been updated to allow HTTP traffic on an SSL domain. Consequently, the protocol parameter description for the request in Create a service has been updated. The statement that indicated that domains must use the same protocol has been deleted.
The ttl parameter description for the request in Create a service has been updated. The maximum value that you can specify for ttl is 365 days.
The table in Absolute limits has been updated to include the limits for TTL and the number of domains that can be listed.
Initial Unlimited Access (UA) release.
Initial Early Access (EA) release.

preface.title: Preface
preface.para: This document describes new features and changes for the Rackspace CDN API.

chapter.title: Document change history
chapter.para: This version of the release notes replaces and obsoletes all earlier versions. The most recent changes are described in the following table:

chapter.title: September 11, 2015
chapter.para: This release includes the following changes for the Rackspace CDN API.

itemizedlist.title: Product enhancements
itemizedlist.para: Rackspace CDN has been updated to include the following changes:

listitem.para: Added the geography parameter to restrictions for the Create a service operation to enable the specification of a country that you want to restrict requests from.
Added project_id to the response for the Retrieve a service and Retrieve all services operations.

itemizedlist.title: Documentation
itemizedlist.para: The following additions were made to the Rackspace CDN Developer Guide:

listitem.para: Added the geography parameter to restrictions for the Create a service operation to enable the specification of a country that you want to restrict requests from.
Added project_id to the response for the Retrieve a service and Retrieve all services operations.
Added SLA information to the Purge a cached asset operation.

chapter.title: August 26, 2015
chapter.para: This release includes the following changes for the Rackspace CDN API.

itemizedlist.title: Product enhancements
itemizedlist.para: Rackspace CDN has been updated to include the following changes:

listitem.para: Added cache invalidation to the Purge a cached asset operation by adding the hard query parameter. The default value for hard is set to false, which does cache invalidation, while setting hard to true does an actual purge.
Added access with valid values of whitelist and blacklist to restrictions for the Create a service operation to allow or block access.
Added request_url and client_ip to rules for the Create a service operation to enable restriction rules for URLs and IP addresses.
Fixed an issue to now disallow entering a root domain for the domain field in a service.
Fixed an issue where now a TTL of 0 seconds is treated as “no-cache” with Akamai.

itemizedlist.title: Documentation
itemizedlist.para: The following additions were made to the Rackspace CDN Developer Guide:

listitem.para: Added cache invalidation to the Purge a cached asset operation by adding the hard query parameter. The default value for hard is set to false, which does cache invalidation, while setting hard to true does an actual purge.
Added access with valid values of whitelist and blacklist to restrictions for the Create a service operation to allow or block access.
Added request_url and client_ip to rules for the Create a service operation to enable restriction rules for URLs and IP addresses.

chapter.title: July 14, 2015
chapter.para: This release includes the following changes for the Rackspace CDN API.

listitem.para: Rackspace CDN has been updated to include host header information by adding the hostheadertype and hostheadervalue parameters to the Create a service request.
In the Rackspace CDN Developer Guide, the hostheadertype and hostheadervalue parameter descriptions were added to the request in Create a service.

chapter.title: June 10, 2015
chapter.para: This release includes the following changes for the Rackspace CDN API.

listitem.para: Rackspace CDN has been updated to allow HTTP traffic on an SSL domain. Consequently, the Rackspace CDN Developer Guide has been updated. The protocol parameter description for the request in Create a service has been changed. The statement that indicated that domains must use the same protocol has been deleted.
In the Rackspace CDN Developer Guide, the ttl parameter description for the request in Create a service has been updated. The maximum value that you can specify for ttl is 365 days.
In the Rackspace CDN Developer Guide, the table in Absolute limits has been updated to include the limits for TTL and the number of domains that can be listed.

chapter.title: April 27, 2015
chapter.para: This release is the initial Unlimited Access (UA) release of the Rackspace CDN API.

chapter.title: January 07, 2015
